title: US stocks fall after Fed minutes, Nvidia shares climb
summary: US stocks fell on Wednesday as investors digested minutes of the Federal Reserve's most recent meeting but Nvidia's shares rose about 6% after the close on the semiconductor bellwether's stronger-than-expected revenue forecast.
content:
The Dow fell 201.95 points, or 0.51%, to close at 39,671.04, the S&P 500 lost 14.40 points, or 0.27%, to 5,307.01 and the Nasdaq dropped 31.08 points, or 0.18%, to 16,801.54.

NEW YORK: US stocks fell on Wednesday as investors digested minutes of the Federal Reserve's most recent meeting but Nvidia's shares rose about 6% after the close on the semiconductor bellwether's stronger-than-expected revenue forecast.

The news also drove gains in other chipm

title: Ahmad Zahid arrives in Hong Kong for official visit
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi arrived in Hong Kong on Wednesday for an official 11-day visit.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi arrived in Hong Kong on Wednesday for an official 11-day visit.

A post on Facebook stated that Ahmad Zahid was welcomed upon arrival by Deputy Foreign Minister Datuk Mohamad Alamin, Malaysian Consul-General in Hong Kong Muzambli Markam, and consulate staff.

“Tomorrow, I am scheduled to meet with Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) chief executive John Lee Ka-chiu.

title: Banks show support for govt housing rescue plan
summary: China’s mega banks are urging branch managers to lend to state-owned companies that buy unsold homes, offering a quick show of support for the government’s housing rescue package unveiled last week.
content:
The directives underscore the urgency in addressing the nation’s property crisis. — Bloomberg

Beijing: China’s mega banks are urging branch managers to lend to state-owned companies that buy unsold homes, offering a quick show of support for the government’s housing rescue package unveiled last week.

Industrial & Commercial Bank of China Ltd (ICBC) and other state lenders are guiding managers to lend against the purchased properties as collateral, a

title: Paytm signals job cuts, asset sales after regulatory probe
summary: Paytm has warned of job cuts and says it will trim non-core assets after reporting its first sales decline on record, reflecting fallout from a regulatory probe that curtailed much of the Indian financial technology (fintech) pioneer’s business.
content:
Paytm’s net losses swelled several-fold to 5.5 billion rupees for the three months through March. — Bloomberg

Mumbai: Paytm has warned of job cuts and says it will trim non-core assets after reporting its first sales decline on record, reflecting fallout from a regulatory probe that curtailed much of the Indian financial technology (fintech) pioneer’s business.

Once a role model for India’s nascent startup economy, Paytm’s net losses swelled several-fol

title: Tesla’s Europe sales decline
summary: Tesla Inc got off to a sluggish start to the second quarter in Europe, where chief executive officer Elon Musk was expecting a much better showing than the first few months of the year.
content:
The carmaker registered just 13,951 vehicles in April, down 2.3% from a year ago and its worst tally since January 2023. — Bloomberg

LONDON: Tesla Inc got off to a sluggish start to the second quarter in Europe, where chief executive officer Elon Musk was expecting a much better showing than the first few months of the year.

The carmaker registered just 13,951 vehicles in April, the European Automobile Manufacturers’ Association said yesterday, down 2.3

title: UK central bank warns markets of change
summary: Bank of England (BoE) governor Andrew Bailey says markets should prepare for a big increase in securities repurchase operations as the UK central bank reduces the reserves it built up during the financial crisis and pandemic.
content:
Bold move: Bailey delivers a lecture at the London School of Economics. The BoE governor wants to make the transition to free the central bank from interest rate risk that has placed it under intense political scrutiny. — Bloomberg

title: Hextar hopeful about prospects
summary: Hextar Industries Bhd saw its net profit for the first quarter ended March 31 plunging 78.1% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM4.5mil, while group revenue eased 11.8% to RM238mil.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Hextar Industries Bhd saw its net profit for the first quarter ended March 31 plunging 78.1% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM4.5mil, while group revenue eased 11.8% to RM238mil.

title: Bank Indonesia signals no further rate increases
summary: Indonesia’s central bank held interest rates unchanged yesterday, as expected, with governor Perry Warjiyo reiterating that the current benchmark level is likely enough to keep inflation in check and the rupiah currency stable.
content:
Bank Indonesia kept the benchmark seven-day reverse repurchase rate at 6.25%. — Reuters

JAKARTA: Indonesia’s central bank held interest rates unchanged yesterday, as expected, with governor Perry Warjiyo reiterating that the current benchmark level is likely enough to keep inflation in check and the rupiah currency stable.

Bank Indonesia (BI) kept the benchmark seven-day reverse repurchase rate at 6.25%, as predicted unanimously by 33 economists in a Re

title: India’s mid-tier firms gain share
summary: Mid-tier firms in India’s US$254bil information technology sector took market share from industry goliaths in recent quarters as clients curtailed discretionary spending amid inflationary pressures and economic uncertainty, analysts say.
content:
Mid-tier IT firms tend to focus on short-term deals aimed at helping clients cut costs rather than chase large-scale projects. — Reuters

BENGALURU: Mid-tier firms in India’s US$254bil information technology sector took market share from industry goliaths in recent quarters as clients curtailed discretionary spending amid inflationary pressures and economic uncertainty, analysts say.

Unlike their larger rivals, such as Tata Consultancy Services and Infos

Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Aziz.

title: Madani framework catalyst in Bursa rally
summary: The rally in the local equity market has been underpinned by the policy measures introduced by Putrajaya under the Madani framework and macro factors like the China + 1 strategy global investors have adopted as economic tensions rise between Beijing and the West.
content:
Investor Ian Yoong Kah Yin.

PETALING JAYA: The rally in the local equity market has been underpinned by the policy measures introduced by Putrajaya under the Madani framework and macro factors like the China + 1 strategy global investors have adopted as economic tensions rise between Beijing and the West.

title: High capacity signals economic recovery
summary: The manufacturing industry operating at 80.8% for the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) is a good signal that the economy is on track and is likely to continue this way for the rest of the year.
content:
Sunway University professor of economics Prof Yeah Kim Leng.

PETALING JAYA: The manufacturing industry operating at 80.8% for the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) is a good signal that the economy is on track and is likely to continue this way for the rest of the year.

Sunway University professor of economics Prof Yeah Kim Leng told StarBiz that at the current rate, the manufacturing industry is deemed to be operating at full capacity.

title: Yield at 11-year high amid bets for further tightening
summary: Japan’s 10-year government bond yield rose to an 11-year high of 1% amid mounting bets for further Bank of Japan (BoJ) policy tightening this year, while a weak auction of 40-year debt added to the pressure for higher yields.
content:
Cautious approach: Ueda at an economics talk in Tokyo. The central bank governor adopted a more hawkish tone two weeks ago and following a meeting with Kishida says the BoJ will be “vigilant” to yen moves in setting policy. — Bloomberg

TOKYO: Japan’s 10-year government bond yield rose to an 11-year high of 1% amid mounting bets for further Bank of Japan (BoJ) policy tightening this year, while a weak auction of 40-year debt added to the pressure for higher yi

title: Mega First sees better earnings for core ops
summary: Mega First Corp Bhd posted a RM95.5mil net profit for its first quarter ended March 31 (1Q24), representing a 35.5% year-on-year (y-o-y) surge despite revenue dropping by 9.8% to RM313mil.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Mega First Corp Bhd posted a RM95.5mil net profit for its first quarter ended March 31 (1Q24), representing a 35.5% year-on-year (y-o-y) surge despite revenue dropping by 9.8% to RM313mil.

title: Blistering solar growth runs into grid blocks
summary: China’s breakneck build-out of solar power, fuelled by rock-bottom equipment prices and policy support, is slowing as grid bottlenecks pile up, market reforms increase uncertainty for generators, and the best rooftop space runs short.
content:
New problems: Workers cleaning solar panels on a rooftop in Jinan, Shandong province. The province is now facing the difficulties of rapid growth in the sector. — AP

BEIJING: China’s breakneck build-out of solar power, fuelled by rock-bottom equipment prices and policy support, is slowing as grid bottlenecks pile up, market reforms increase uncertainty for generators, and the best rooftop space runs short.

title: Australia’s LNG sector is long-term bullish, but needs a carbon price
summary: Australia’s natural gas producers are increasingly confident that their fuel is vital to the energy transition and will play a role across Asia up to and beyond the 2050 net-zero emissions targets of companies and countries.
content:
Australia was the world’s biggest LNG exporter until being overtaken by the United States last year. — Reuters

AUSTRALIA’s natural gas producers are increasingly confident that their fuel is vital to the energy transition and will play a role across Asia up to and beyond the 2050 net-zero emissions targets of companies and countries.

This optimism was on full display at the industry’s annual gathering in the capital city of Western Australia state, whic

title: Russian wheat shortfall possible boon to US exporters of corn
summary: Historic heat, dryness and frost have walloped Russia’s winter wheat crop over the last several weeks, slashing harvest estimates for the top exporter and spurring a healthy rally in global wheat prices.
content:
Corn prices are well off yearly lows but have not surged to nearly the extent of wheat, creating a wheat-corn premium not seen in almost two years. — Reuters

HISTORIC heat, dryness and frost have walloped Russia’s winter wheat crop over the last several weeks, slashing harvest estimates for the top exporter and spurring a healthy rally in global wheat prices.

summary: The continued rally in the local stock market despite geopolitical tensions and the higher-for-longer interest rate guidance from the US Federal Reserve is lifting the exchange holding company, Bursa Malaysia Bhd, as well.
content:

title: Anwar arrives in Japan for three-day working visit
summary: TOKYO (May 22): Malaysia's Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim arrived here on Wednesday evening for a three-day working visit to Japan.
content:
TOKYO (May 22): Malaysia's Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim arrived here on Wednesday evening for a three-day working visit to Japan.

The private aircraft carrying Anwar touched down at the Haneda International Airport at about 9pm local time (8pm Malaysian time).

Accompanying Anwar were Minister of Foreign Affairs Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan; Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz; and Minister of Human Resourc

title: Parti Cinta Sabah accepted as GRS component party, says Masidi
summary: KOTA KINABALU (May 22): Parti Cinta Sabah (PCS) has been accepted as a component party of Gabungan Rakyat Sabah (GRS), GRS secretary general Datuk Seri Masidi Manjun announced on Wednesday.
content:
KOTA KINABALU (May 22): Parti Cinta Sabah (PCS) has been accepted as a component party of Gabungan Rakyat Sabah (GRS), GRS secretary general Datuk Seri Masidi Manjun announced on Wednesday.

Masidi said that PCS, through its president Tan Sri Anifah Aman, officially applied to join GRS, and that all presidents of the coalition's component parties unanimously accepted PCS.

"The inclusion of PCS, a local party, is a significant step towards strengthening the unity

title: GlC, GLIC earnings repatriation call lifts pressure on ringgit: Economists
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The initiative to have government-linked companies (GLCs) and government-linked investment companies (GLICs) repatriate their earnings from abroad has been cited as a factor that has helped to lift pressure on the ringgit.Economists believe the strategy will help ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The initiative to have government-linked companies (GLCs) and government-linked investment companies (GLICs) repatriate their earnings from abroad has been cited as a factor that has helped to lift pressure on the ringgit.

Economists believe the strategy will help the country manage risks arising from heightened financial market volatility.

However, they said, domestic structural reforms are still necessary to provide a more enduring support for the ringgit over the medium term.

The ringgit has perform

title: Perlis MB’s son and ex-political secretary to an opposition leader to be charged on Thursday — MACC
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Perlis Menteri Besar Mohd Shukri Ramli's son will be charged at the Kangar Sessions Court on Thursday (May 23), in connection with the submission of false claims amounting to RM600,000, according to the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Perlis Menteri Besar Mohd Shukri Ramli's son will be charged at the Kangar Sessions Court on Thursday (May 23), in connection with the submission of false claims amounting to RM600,000, according to the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC).

MACC chief commissioner Tan Sri Azam Baki said Mohd Shukri's son, who owns a company, will be charged under Section 18 of the MACC Act 2009 at 8am.

Mohd Shukri's son was remanded by the MACC on A

title: UK inflation pressure stays hot, dashing hopes for June rate cut
summary: LONDON: Inflation in Britain eased less than expected and a key core measure of prices barely dropped, prompting investors to pull bets on a Bank of England rate cut next month which could have boosted embattled Prime Minister Rishi Sunak before an election.
content:
LONDON: Inflation in Britain eased less than expected and a key core measure of prices barely dropped, prompting investors to pull bets on a Bank of England rate cut next month which could have boosted embattled Prime Minister Rishi Sunak before an election.

The consumer price index (CPI) rose by 2.3% in the 12 months to April, down sharply from March's 3.2% increase and its lowest since July 2021, the Office for National Statistics said.

But the BoE and economists pol

title: Anwar’s second visit within six months signifies pivotal KL-Tokyo relationship
summary: TOKYO (May 22): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim’s second visit to Japan within six months signifies the comprehensive and important 68-year relationship between the two nations.
content:
TOKYO (May 22): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim’s second visit to Japan within six months signifies the comprehensive and important 68-year relationship between the two nations.

Speaking to the media here on Wednesday, Malaysian Ambassador to Japan Datuk Shahril Effendi Abd Ghany said the visit will be brief but packed with engagements with policymakers and industry captains, as the prime minister needs to be back in Malaysia by the weekend.

title: CIMB forecasts mid-June kickoff for fuel subsidy rationalisation
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): CIMB Investment Bank Bhd anticipates the rollout of fuel subsidy rationalisation to commence in mid-June 2024 at the earliest.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): CIMB Investment Bank Bhd anticipates the rollout of fuel subsidy rationalisation to commence in mid-June 2024 at the earliest. 

This projection aligns with the government's recent indication that the rationalisation will begin with diesel, it said in a note on Wednesday.

"The implementation date was not stated, though we understand that registrations for the diesel fleet card system are due to be in the next month, putting June as the

title: US announces details on higher China tariffs, some to start Aug 1
summary: WASHINGTON: The U.S. Trade Representative's office on Wednesday said some of the steep tariff increases on an array of Chinese imports including electric vehicle batteries, computer chips and medical products will take effect on August 1 after a 30-day comment period ends.
content:
WASHINGTON: The U.S. Trade Representative's office on Wednesday said some of the steep tariff increases on an array of Chinese imports including electric vehicle batteries, computer chips and medical products will take effect on August 1 after a 30-day comment period ends.

President Joe Biden will keep tariffs put in place by his Republican predecessor Donald Trump while ratcheting up others, including a quadrupling of EV duties to over 100% and doubling the duties on semico

title: Five Petroleum to explore partnerships in Uzbekistan
summary: FIVE Petroleum Malaysia Sdn Bhd, a prominent player in the Malaysian energy sector, partook in a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with several key economic bodies in Uzbekistan recently.
content:
FIVE Petroleum Malaysia Sdn Bhd, a prominent player in the Malaysian energy sector, partook in a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with several key economic bodies in Uzbekistan recently.

The MoU aims to explore joint ventures, enhance technological exchange and promote sustainable energy practices among the signatories.

Its founder and chief executive officer Datuk Seri Dr King Lim Chin Fui said the collaboration underscores Five Petroleum's commitment to expanding it

title: Plastic packaging industry may be poised for earnings recovery on improved demand
summary:
THE plastic packaging industry could be in for an earnings recovery this year, given that demand is expected to improve, as some buyers are starting to restock inventories again after a lull in 2023 when stock was kept at a minimum because economic conditions had weakened.

“We see buyin...
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 13, 2024 - May 19, 2024

THE plastic packaging industry could be in for an earnings recovery this year, given that demand is expected to improve, as some buyers are starting to restock inventories again after a lull in 2023 when stock was kept at a minimum because economic conditions had weakened.

title: Gobind: Malaysia-UK collaboration paves way for digital economy advancements
summary: SUBANG JAYA (May 22): Malaysia values its strategic collaboration with the United Kingdom (UK), particularly in digital initiatives, as they pave the way for potential advancements in the digital economy for both nations.
content:
SUBANG JAYA (May 22): Malaysia values its strategic collaboration with the United Kingdom (UK), particularly in digital initiatives, as they pave the way for potential advancements in the digital economy for both nations.

Digital Minister Gobind Singh Deo said as the world stands on the brink of unprecedented technological advancement, Malaysia must capitalise on the opportunities presented through the collaboration, in order to transform into a high-value, digital-based economy.

title: Ulu Tiram incident: Two students released, five other suspects still under detention
summary: JOHOR BAHRU (May 22): Two students who were arrested in connection with the attack on the Ulu Tiram police station here last Friday (May 17) have been released unconditionally, according to police.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (May 22): Two students who were arrested in connection with the attack on the Ulu Tiram police station here last Friday (May 17) have been released unconditionally, according to police.

“The two students held for investigation under Section 302 of the Penal Code have been released unconditionally, following an order from the Attorney General's Chambers in Putrajaya,” Johor police chief M Kumar said in a statement on Wednesday.

title: Japan's 10-year yield hits more than decade high of 1% as BOJ bets build
summary: TOKYO: Japan's 10-year government bond yield rose to an 11-year high of 1% on Wednesday amid mounting bets for further Bank of Japan policy tightening this year, while a weak auction of 40-year debt added to the pressure for higher yields.
content:
TOKYO: Japan's 10-year government bond yield rose to an 11-year high of 1% on Wednesday amid mounting bets for further Bank of Japan policy tightening this year, while a weak auction of 40-year debt added to the pressure for higher yields.

The 10-year JGB yield was last 2 basis points (bps) higher at 1.0%, hovering at the psychologically significant level for the first time since May 2013, in the very early days of former BOJ Governor Haruhiko Kuroda's unprecedented policy-e

title: Indonesian central bank holds interest rates steady, as expected
summary: JAKARTA: Indonesia's central bank held interest rates unchanged at a review on Wednesday, as expected, saying the current benchmark level remained consistent with keeping inflation in check and maintaining the stability of the rupiah currency.
content:
The entrance of Bank Indonesia headquarters in Jakarta. — Bloomberg

JAKARTA: Indonesia's central bank held interest rates unchanged at a review on Wednesday, as expected, saying the current benchmark level remained consistent with keeping inflation in check and maintaining the stability of the rupiah currency.

Bank Indonesia (BI) kept the benchmark 7-day reverse repurchase rate at 6.25%, as predicted unanimously by 33 economists polled by Reuters.

title: Special Report: Seda reviewing future rollout of subsidised green energy projects
summary: AMID rising electricity tariffs and green energy demand, there has been huge interest in the quota for large-scale solar (LSS) and rooftop solar projects. However, the Feed-in Tariff (FiT) programme, through which the government awards quota for other non-conventional renewable energy (RE) source...
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 13, 2024 - May 19, 2024

AMID rising electricity tariffs and green energy demand, there has been huge interest in the quota for large-scale solar (LSS) and rooftop solar projects. However, the Feed-in Tariff (FiT) programme, through which the government awards quota for other non-conventional renewable energy (RE) sources such as biogas, biomass and small hydro power, is not highlighted often enough.

title: M&S annual profit soars 58% as turnaround strategy delivers
summary: LONDON: British retailer Marks & Spencer reported a 58% rise in annual profit, ahead of market expectations, as its strategy to re-shape the business delivered strong sales growth in both its food and clothing divisions.

Pedestrians and shoppers wait to cross a road in front of a Louis Vuitton store, operated by LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE, in the Central district of Hong Kong, China, on Sunday, Oct. 27, 2019. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

title: Nine Malaysians injured in Singapore Airlines SQ321 emergency landing in Bangkok, says ministry
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Malaysia's Foreign Ministry, through the Embassy of Malaysia in Bangkok, Thailand, confirmed that nine Malaysians, including a crew member, were injured on board Singapore Airlines (SIA) Flight SQ321.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Malaysia's Foreign Ministry, through the Embassy of Malaysia in Bangkok, Thailand, confirmed that nine Malaysians, including a crew member, were injured on board Singapore Airlines (SIA) Flight SQ321.

The airplane was flying from London to Singapore, when it made an emergency landing at Suvarnabhumi International Airport in Bangkok, Thailand, on Tuesday (May 21).

title: RM5.8bil UMW acquisition to bolster Sime Darby's product portfolio: CIMB Securities
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The RM5.8 billion UMW Holdings Bhd acquisition is expected to strengthen Sime Darby Bhd's presence in Malaysia and broaden its products portfolio. CIMB Securities said this is especially in the entry-level and mid-market automotive segments currently dominated ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The RM5.8 billion UMW Holdings Bhd acquisition is expected to strengthen Sime Darby Bhd's presence in Malaysia and broaden its products portfolio. 

CIMB Securities said this is especially in the entry-level and mid-market automotive segments currently dominated by Perodua and Toyota.

"With the inclusion of UMW Toyota and Perodua, we project Sime Darby's share of new vehicle sales in Malaysia to surge from 4.0 per cent in calendar year 2023 (CY23) to 60 per cent in CY24," it said in a note.

title: Most Asian currencies flat ahead of Fed minutes; stocks edge up
summary: BENGALURU: Most Asian currencies struggled for momentum on Wednesday, while stocks inched higher as investors awaited minutes of the US Federal Reserve's latest policy meeting and an interest rate decision from Bank Indonesia for further direction.MSCI's broadest ...
content:
BENGALURU: Most Asian currencies struggled for momentum on Wednesday, while stocks inched higher as investors awaited minutes of the US Federal Reserve's latest policy meeting and an interest rate decision from Bank Indonesia for further direction.

MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan rose 0.4%. Shares in Taiwan climbed more than 1% to hit a record high, with investors awaiting Nvidia's quarterly results.

content:
KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Investment Bank Bhd anticipates the rollout of fuel subsidy rationalisation to commence in mid-June 2024 at the earliest. 

This projection aligns with the government's recent indication that the rationalisation will begin with diesel, it said in a note today.

"The implementation date was not stated, though we understand that registrations for the diesel fleet card system are due to be in the next month, putting June as the earliest start date.

title: With patent restriction over, JF Technology set to regain foothold in US market
summary:
A decade after becoming embroiled in a patent infringement lawsuit in the US, one-stop test engineering and test interface solutions provider JF Technology Bhd (KL:JFTECH) is revisiting its US market strategy now that it is no longer bound by a patent restriction.

JF Tech co-founder and...
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 13, 2024 - May 19, 2024

A decade after becoming embroiled in a patent infringement lawsuit in the US, one-stop test engineering and test interface solutions provider JF Technology Bhd (KL:JFTECH) is revisiting its US market strategy now that it is no longer bound by a patent restriction.

title: Asia stocks up on high hopes for Nvidia, NZ dollar jumps
summary: SYDNEY: Asian shares edged higher on Wednesday as anxious investors dared to hope AI-diva Nvidia could meet sky-high expectations, while also keeping a wary eye on the outlook for U.S. and UK interest rates.
content:
SYDNEY: Asian shares edged higher on Wednesday as anxious investors dared to hope AI-diva Nvidia could meet sky-high expectations, while also keeping a wary eye on the outlook for U.S. and UK interest rates.

New Zealand's central bank offered a sobering assessment of its inflation problems, warning that rates would have to be higher for longer to bring them to heel in a shock to local markets.

That saw the kiwi dollar jump 0.9% to a one-month high of $0.6151 as bond yi

title: CIMB forecasts mid-June kickoff for fuel subsidy rationalisation
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Treasury and Markets Research anticipates the rollout of fuel subsidy rationalisation to commence in mid-June 2024 at the earliest.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Treasury and Markets Research anticipates the rollout of fuel subsidy rationalisation to commence in mid-June 2024 at the earliest.

This projection aligns with the government's recent indication that the rationalisation will begin with diesel, it said in a note today.

"The implementation date was not stated, though we understand that registrations for the diesel fleet card system are due to be in the next month, putting June as the earliest start d

title: Corporation, MOT offer free rides on Putrajaya trackless trams during trial runs till July 31, 2024
summary: PUTRAJAYA (May 22): Putrajaya Corporation (PPj), in collaboration with the Ministry of Transport (MOT),  is having a trial run of the Automated Rapid Transit (ART) trackless tram here, until July 31 this year.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (May 22): Putrajaya Corporation (PPj), in collaboration with the Ministry of Transport (MOT),  is having a trial run of the Automated Rapid Transit (ART) trackless tram here, until July 31 this year.

If everything goes well, the ART tram service, which uses technology from China's CRRC Corporation Ltd, the main manufacturer of rail systems and components in the world, will start by year-end.

PPj engineering and maintenance department (traffic and

title: King, Queen extend Happy Wesak Day greetings to all Malaysian Buddhists
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim and Her Majesty Raja Zarith Sofiah, the King and Queen of Malaysia, wished Malaysian Buddhists on Thursday, a Happy Wesak Day.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim and Her Majesty Raja Zarith Sofiah, the King and Queen of Malaysia, wished Malaysian Buddhists on Thursday, a Happy Wesak Day.

Their Majesties said that racial harmony is the pillar of national unity.

“Happy Wesak Day to all Buddhists in this country,” said Their Majesties in a post on Sultan Ibrahim Sultan Iskandar's Facebook page.

title: New Zealand dollar surges on surprisingly hawkish RBNZ
summary: SYDNEY: The New Zealand dollar rose almost 1% on Wednesday to its highest level in two months as the central bank lifted its forecasts for peak interest rates and pushed back when it expects cuts, in a hawkish surprise that also sent the kiwi flying on its Aussie counterpart.
content:
SYDNEY: The New Zealand dollar rose almost 1% on Wednesday to its highest level in two months as the central bank lifted its forecasts for peak interest rates and pushed back when it expects cuts, in a hawkish surprise that also sent the kiwi flying on its Aussie counterpart.

Local yields also climbed as investors scaled back bets of any easing, although their timeframe is more optimistic than the Reserve Bank of New Zealand's own forecast of a first rate cut in late 2025.</

title: MySay: Sweden is sharing its success in restoring ecosystems with Malaysia
summary: May 22 is the United Nations International Day for Biological Diversity, and the situation is dire. Over one million species are endangered, and the populations of wild mammals, fish and birds have declined by 69% on average since 1970, according to the Living Planet Index. This decline in biodiversity is closely linked to the destruction of habitats.
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 20, 2024 - May 26, 2024

May 22 is the United Nations International Day for Biological Diversity, and the situation is dire. Over one million species are endangered, and the populations of wild mammals, fish and birds have declined by 69% on average since 1970, according to the Living Planet Index. This decline in biodiversity is closely linked to the destruction of habitats.

title: China's first batch of ultra-long special bonds surge on debut, triggering suspension
summary: SHANGHAI: The first batch of China's 1-trillion-yuan ($138.14 billion)ultra-long special treasury bonds, which debuted on Wednesday, surged 25% in the early session on the Shanghai stock exchange, triggering trading suspensions.
content:
SHANGHAI: The first batch of China's 1-trillion-yuan ($138.14 billion)ultra-long special treasury bonds, which debuted on Wednesday, surged 25% in the early session on the Shanghai stock exchange, triggering trading suspensions.

The 30-year sovereign bonds jumped more than 13% at the open, prompting a 30-minute suspension by the Shanghai Stock Exchange, which cited "abnormal fluctuations" and urged investors to be rational.

Trading was suspended again until late aftern

title: Targeted diesel subsidy to strengthen govt fiscal position, improve resource allocation
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The implementation of a targeted diesel subsidy for consumers in Peninsular Malaysia, expected to save RM4 billion annually, will strengthen the government's fiscal position and improve resource allocation while reducing fossil fuel consumption and carbon footprint.Sunway ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The implementation of a targeted diesel subsidy for consumers in Peninsular Malaysia, expected to save RM4 billion annually, will strengthen the government's fiscal position and improve resource allocation while reducing fossil fuel consumption and carbon footprint.

Sunway University professor of economics Prof Yeah Kim Leng said the rationalisation is anticipated to benefit both the economy and the government by demonstrating a commitment to necessary reforms for fiscal sustainability and economic efficiency

title: KTI to raise RM48m from Ace Market Listing
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Sabah-based developer KTI Landmark Bhd aims to raise RM48 million under its listing exercise on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia for expansion. KTI is scheduled to list on the ACE Market of Bursa Securities on June 19, 2024. It ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sabah-based developer KTI Landmark Bhd aims to raise RM48 million under its listing exercise on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia for expansion. 

KTI is scheduled to list on the ACE Market of Bursa Securities on June 19, 2024. 

It plans to use RM20.7 million (43.1 per cent) of the proceeds raised from the initial public offering (IPO) to supplement its general working capital requirements for The Logg's project.  

This includes construction costs, consultants' and professional fees, and local

title: Powering growth potential
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's electricity infrastructure stands resilient and ready to meet the growing needs of both residential and industrial sectors including energy-intensive data centres, economists said.They pointed out that the country's current power reserve margin at around ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's electricity infrastructure stands resilient and ready to meet the growing needs of both residential and industrial sectors including energy-intensive data centres, economists said.

They pointed out that the country's current power reserve margin at around the low 40 per cent range should be more than sufficient for the current needs of the data centres.

Sunway University economics professor Dr Yeah Kim Leng said the current excess electricity reserve margin in Peninsular Malaysia is esti

title: Skyworld’s 4Q net profit down 64%, plans projects worth RM1b in FY2025
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Property developer Skyworld Development Bhd (KL:SKYWLD) said on Tuesday (May 21) that its net profit for the fourth quarter was down 64% from a year earlier, mainly on lower revenue and higher expenses.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Property developer Skyworld Development Bhd (KL:SKYWLD) said on Tuesday (May 21) that its net profit for the fourth quarter was down 64% from a year earlier, mainly on lower revenue and higher expenses.

Net profit for the three months ended March 31, 2024 (4QFY2024) totalled RM20.75 million, compared to RM58.2 million over the same quarter a year earlier, Skyworld said in an exchange filing. Revenue for the quarter declined 30% to RM158.29 million, from RM225.95 million.

title: Banks, mining stocks lift Australian shares higher
summary: AUSTRALIAN shares advanced on Wednesday, led by financials and mining stocks that tracked a hike in commodity prices, as demand prospects improved in top consumer China.
content:
FILE PHOTO: A board displaying stock prices is adorned with the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) logo in central Sydney, Australia, February 13, 2018. Picture taken February 13, 2018. REUTERS/David Gray/File Photo

AUSTRALIAN shares advanced on Wednesday, led by financials and mining stocks that tracked a hike in commodity prices, as demand prospects improved in top consumer China.

title: Fed officials urge patience on timing of initial rate cut
summary: WASHINGTON/AMELIA ISLAND: Federal Reserve policymakers said on Tuesday the U.S. central bank should wait several more months to ensure that inflation really is back on track to its 2% target before cutting interest rates.
content:
FILE PHOTO: Cleveland Federal Reserve President Loretta Mester. REUTERS/ Ann Saphir/File Photo

WASHINGTON/AMELIA ISLAND: Federal Reserve policymakers said on Tuesday the U.S. central bank should wait several more months to ensure that inflation really is back on track to its 2% target before cutting interest rates.

title: US stocks end slightly higher after Fed comments
summary: US stocks closed with slight gains on Tuesday, sending the S&P 500 and Nasdaq to record levels, as investors assessed the latest comments from Federal Reserve officials for clues on the timing of a rate cut while quarterly earnings from Nvidia drew closer.
content:
The Dow rose 66.22 points, or 0.17%, to 39,872.99, the S&P 500 gained 13.28 points, or 0.25%, to 5,321.41 and the Nasdaq gained 37.75 points, or 0.22%, to 16,832.62.

NEW YORK: US stocks closed with slight gains on Tuesday, sending the S&P 500 and Nasdaq to record levels, as investors assessed the latest comments from Federal Reserve officials for clues on the timing of a rate cut while quarterly earnings from Nvidia drew closer.

title: Oil prices fall 1% on sticky US inflation
summary: Oil prices settled 1% lower on Tuesday as lingering US inflation looked likely to keep interest rates higher for longer, weighing on fuel demand.
content:
Brent crude futures settled down 83 cents, or 1%, to US$82.88 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude (WTI) futures for June, which expired on Tuesday, slipped by 54 cents, or 0.7%, to US$79.26.

HOUSTON: Oil prices settled 1% lower on Tuesday as lingering US inflation looked likely to keep interest rates higher for longer, weighing on fuel demand.

Brent crude futures settled down 83 cents, or 1%, to US$82.88 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude

title: Asean+3: A technology powerhouse in the making
summary: The Asean+3 region is home to some of the world’s most innovative and technologically advanced economies. This region has accounted for over 60% of global patents since the early 2010s, primarily contributed by China, Japan and South Korea.
content: This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 20, 2024 - May 26, 2024

title: Collaborative Research Initiatives for a Global Impact
summary: The world today is becoming more connected, paving the way for collaborative research initiatives that are increasingly becoming the cornerstone in addressing complex global challenges. Universities play a pivotal role in fostering such collaborations, leveraging their diverse expertise and resources to make a meaningful impact on society.
content: The world today is becoming more connected, paving the way for collaborative research initiatives that are increasingly becoming the cornerstone in addressing complex global challenges. Universities play a pivotal role in fostering such collaborations, leveraging their diverse expertise and resources to make a meaningful impact on society.

title: 16 Malaysians among passengers aboard London-Singapore flight SQ321
summary: Sixteen Malaysians were among the 211 passengers aboard Singapore Airlines (SIA) flight SQ321 from London to Singapore that was forced to make an emergency landing at Suvarnabhumi Airport, on Tuesday afternoon.
content:
SINGAPORE (May 22): Sixteen Malaysians were among the 211 passengers aboard Singapore Airlines (SIA) flight SQ321 from London to Singapore that was forced to make an emergency landing at Suvarnabhumi Airport, on Tuesday afternoon.

SIA, in its latest update at 10.35pm on Facebook, however, did not specify their conditions.

There were also 41 passengers from Singapore, the UK (47), Australia (56), Canada (two), Germany (one), India (three), Indonesia (two), Icelan

title: Pos Malaysia, Hartalega, Kossan, Hong Seng, Sunway, PetDag, Affin, Bank Islam, Hibiscus, LBS, Sime Darby Property, Lagenda Properties
summary: Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Tuesday:
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Tuesday:

Pos Malaysia Bhd (KL:POS) is selling its ship-chartering unit that mainly deals with bulk cargoes for RM123.21 million as part of a move to shed non-core businesses. The proposed sale of PNSL Bhd to SWA Shipping Sdn Bhd will also settle outstanding intra-group trading debts and advances owed to Pos Malaysia. The disposal came at a time when the group announced anot

title: Magma plans to raise RM100 mil via redeemable convertible note issuance
summary: Magma Group Bhd (KL:MAGMA), formerly known as Impiana Hotels Bhd, plans to undertake an issuance of redeemable convertible notes (RCNs) to raise up to RM100 million to repay borrowings and fund working capital.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Magma Group Bhd (KL:MAGMA), formerly known as Impiana Hotels Bhd, plans to undertake an issuance of redeemable convertible notes (RCNs) to raise up to RM100 million to repay borrowings and fund working capital.

According to a bourse filing on Tuesday, the notes, which will mature in 36 months with 2% interest per annum payable quarterly, will be privately placed to Advance Opportunities Fund VCC (AOF VCC) and Advance Opportunities Fund 1 (AOF 1).

title: KNM receives nomination for new directors ahead of June 6 AGM
summary: KNM Group Bhd (KL:KNM) has received a written notice from a solicitor proposing the appointment of new directors for its upcoming annual general meeting (AGM) scheduled for June 6, 2024.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 21): KNM Group Bhd (KL:KNM) has received a written notice from a solicitor proposing the appointment of new directors for its upcoming annual general meeting (AGM) scheduled for June 6, 2024.

In a bourse filing, the cash-strapped engineering group said a group of the company's members, represented by Messrs Cheang and Ariff, has nominated four people to be appointed to its board of directors, namely: Handal Energy’s chief executive officer William H Vanvliet III, Wong Tong Sing, Wan Kamarudii

title: Hextar Industries posts 78% drop in 1Q earnings on lower ASP, higher raw material costs
summary: Hextar Industries Bhd (KL:HEXIND) saw its net profit tumble 78.1% year-on-year for the first quarter ended March 31, 2024 (1QFY2024), dragged by lower average selling prices (ASP) and higher raw material costs due to the weaker ringgit despite higher sales volume of fertilisers
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): Hextar Industries Bhd (KL:HEXIND) saw its net profit tumble 78.1% year-on-year for the first quarter ended March 31, 2024 (1QFY2024), dragged by lower average selling prices (ASP) and higher raw material costs due to the weaker ringgit despite higher sales volume of fertilisers 

In a filing with Bursa Malaysia on Tuesday, Hextar Industries posted a net profit of RM4.47 million for the quarter under review compared to RM20.42 million a year earlier, on the back of a 11.77% lower reve

title: Govt pledges to break stagnant wage with progressive wage policy — PM
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Tuesday said that the government is taking it seriously to develop the progressive wage policy (PWP) to address the issue of low wages, especially among the younger generation and graduates.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 21): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Tuesday said that the government is taking it seriously to develop the progressive wage policy (PWP) to address the issue of low wages, especially among the younger generation and graduates.

“As I stated previously, we have been trapped in a dangerous economic cycle; higher costs [of living], low wages, low profits and reduce in competitiveness,” Anwar said in his special address broadcasted on Tuesday night.

title: LBS posts flat 1Q net profit as revenue drops to lowest in nearly three years
summary: LBS Bina Group Bhd’s (KL:LBS) net profit rose by a marginal 0.11% to RM30.53 million in the first quarter ended March 31, 2024 (1QFY2024), from RM30.5 million a year earlier, helped by increased contribution from its property development business. Earnings per share increased to 1.49 sen from 1.48 sen.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 22): LBS Bina Group Bhd’s (KL:LBS) net profit rose by a marginal 0.11% to RM30.53 million in the first quarter ended March 31, 2024 (1QFY2024), from RM30.5 million a year earlier, helped by increased contribution from its property development business. Earnings per share increased to 1.49 sen from 1.48 sen.

Quarterly revenue, however, was down 11.11% to RM342.09 million from RM384.86 million in 1QFY2023 amid lower contributions from both the property development, construction and trading segm

title: China boosts crude oil storage amid soft refinery processing
summary: The pace at which crude oil flowed into China’s stockpiles increased in April as slower refinery processing outweighed a decline in imports.
content:
Stocking up: China National Petroleum Corp’s facilities in Dalian. While domestic oil production is slightly higher, rising 2.1% in the first four months of 2024, it seems that China is adding to inventories at a faster pace so far this year than it did in 2023. — Reuters

THE pace at which crude oil flowed into China’s stockpiles increased in April as slower refinery processing outweighed a decline in imports.

A total of 830,000 barrels per day (bpd) wa

title: Private equity is no place for your nest egg
summary: Retirement is expensive. If you’re lucky, yours will last a few decades and you’ll be earning no or very little income. So if you want to have enough money when you retire, you basically have three options: Save more, take more risk with your investments or work longer.
content:
There are a dearth of good products and strategies to help retirees spend their assets. — Bloomberg

RETIREMENT is expensive. If you’re lucky, yours will last a few decades and you’ll be earning no or very little income. So if you want to have enough money when you retire, you basically have three options: Save more, take more risk with your investments or work longer.

Many people find the first and third options undesirable or impossible. That leaves th

title: Vietnam’s black pepper price hits all-time high
summary: Domestic black pepper prices reached a new record at 111,000 dong to 112,000 dong per kg last week, surging by an additional 10,000 dong per kg from the beginning of last week.
content:
Experts attribute the surge in domestic black pepper prices to a combination of supply shortages and increased demand in major markets. — VNA/VNS

HANOI: Domestic black pepper prices reached a new record at 111,000 dong to 112,000 dong per kg last week, surging by an additional 10,000 dong per kg from the beginning of last week.

Early last week, black pepper prices in the Vietnamese market held steady at approximately 101,000 dong to 102,000 dong per kg.

title: Viettel Global ranks third in market capitalisation
summary: Amid the surging wave of telecommunications and technology stocks on the Vietnamese stock market, Viettel Global Investment JSC (VGI) has emerged a rising star, capturing significant attention as its stock price climbs to record levels.
content:
With the market capitalisation exceeding US$11bil, Viettel Global has outperformed many well-established companies. — Vietnam News

HANOI: Amid the surging wave of telecommunications and technology stocks on the Vietnamese stock market, Viettel Global Investment JSC (VGI) has emerged a rising star, capturing significant attention as its stock price climbs to record levels.

Within three months, the company’s market value has more than tripled, reaching an

title: Vietnam companies urged to focus on online brand protection
summary: As more Vietnamese businesses use international e-Commerce platforms such as Amazon, eBay and Alibaba to expand their market, experts are advising domestic firms to pay greater attention to the protection of trademarks in cyberspace, especially in online exporting activities.
content:
Experts said that in order to protect their brands on international e-Commerce platforms, it is important for Vietnamese firms to clearly understand the regulations and procedures for registering brand protection in each country and on each platform. — Vietnam News

title: Dimon is ‘cautiously pessimistic’ on economy
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is telling investors the bank’s succession plans are underway, while warning investors yesterday about risks to the economic outlook.
content:
Dimon: We're on the way, we're moving people around. The timetable is not five years anymore. - AFP

NEW YORK: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is telling investors the bank’s succession plans are underway, while warning investors yesterday about risks to the economic outlook.

The Wall Street firm’s shares closed almost 4% lower after Dimon told a New York gathering of investors that the bank will practice restraint on share repurchases and that he no long

title: Affin to focus on Casa, high margin operations
summary: Affin Bank Bhd, which reported that net interest margin compression in the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) had impacted its bottom line, will remain focused on expanding its current account savings account (Casa) franchise and high-margin businesses while optimising costs.
content:
Affin Bank Bhd president and group CEO Datuk Wan Razly Abdullah.

KUALA LUMPUR: Affin Bank Bhd, which reported that net interest margin compression in the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) had impacted its bottom line, will remain focused on expanding its current account savings account (Casa) franchise and high-margin businesses while optimising costs.

The bank said net profit in 1Q24 came to RM110.21mil, down 26% from RM148.98mil in the same quarter in 2023

title: Economic achievement in 1Q 2024 very encouraging — Anwar
summary: Malaysia recorded an encouraging economic achievement in the first quarter (1Q) of 2024 at 4.2%, surpassing the expectations of many parties who projected the growth rate at 3.9%, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 21): Malaysia recorded an encouraging economic achievement in the first quarter (1Q) of 2024 at 4.2%, surpassing the expectations of many parties who projected the growth rate at 3.9%, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

“In a global economic environment which continues to be uncertain, almost all sectors have surged and catalysed the growth in the first quarter of 2024.

“This macroeconomic achievement should be celebrated together,”

title: Malaysia's investment record to jump further this year, says Anwar
summary: The country's investment record is expected to jump further this year compared to 2023, evidenced by potential foreign investments totalling RM76.1 billion that have been successfully attracted as of March 2024, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 21): The country's investment record is expected to jump further this year compared to 2023, evidenced by potential foreign investments totalling RM76.1 billion that have been successfully attracted as of March 2024, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

He said the amount was recorded through traditional investors such as the US and China, and included investments from Australia worth RM24.5 billion as well as Germany and France (RM46 billion).
